activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L. Simon

records.addlTxt:
09:03 AM Defendant Jacob L. Simon appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jacob L. Simon. Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Magallones would like a separate arraignment date. Bond continued. adj. 09:06 PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:59 PM Defendant Jacob L. Simon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jacob L. Simon.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
In receipt, waive reading - request preliminary hearing.
Bail continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:29 PM Defendant Jacob L. Simon appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Defendant is on a probation hold. Court sets bond. adj. 01:34 PM
